page.title: 10THE CHURCHES IN FELTWELL
page.content: We have three churches in Feltwell. One is redundant. It is St. Nicholas' and there is only one service held there each year now. The other is St. Mary's which is still going strong. St. Mary's was built between l275 and 1375. About 70 people go to church on Sundays. The Rector and the Church Council run the church. The Rector has been changed five times in the last twenty years. People mostly go to St. Mary's because they find it more interesting, more room and people find friends there. The Methodist church is in Bell Street but it is only about 50 years old. There were once two smaller chapels. The Methodist minister has two other churches to look after as well as Feltwell. There is not a Roman Catholic church in the village.
